title: How to Hide Photos

steps.headline: Open the Photos app and click on the picture you want to hide.
steps.description: The Photos app, which looks similar to a rainbow flower, is one of the automatic apps that show up on your phone. Open the app and scroll until you find the picture you want to hide, selecting it with your finger. If you’re trying to hide multiple pictures, continue touching the pictures until they’re all selected.

steps.headline: Locate the Share icon and press it.
steps.description: The Share icon is a box with an arrow in the middle of the box pointing straight upwards. It should be at the bottom of your screen once the photo is selected. Click on the Share icon once you’ve located it. If there aren't any icons showing up on the photo you selected, press on the photo once and they should appear.

steps.headline: Scroll to the right until you see the Hide option.
steps.description: Once you tap the Share icon, a new row of icons will pop up on the bottom of the screen. Scroll to the right using your finger until you see Hide, with an icon of 2 rectangles with a slash going across them.

steps.headline: Click Hide to remove the photo from the main album.
steps.description:
After clicking the Hide icon, a message will pop up asking you to “Hide Photo” or “Cancel.” Click “Hide Photo” to remove the picture. The message also says, “This photo will be hidden from Moments, Collections, and Years, but still visible in Albums.”
If you use iCloud, your photo will now be hidden on all your other devices as well.

steps.headline: Find your hidden photos in an album called “Hidden.” If you later want to find the pictures you’ve hidden, open your Photos app and click on Albums.
steps.description: Scroll until you see the Hidden album, which has the icon of the 2 rectangles with a slash across them. Clicking on this album will show you your hidden pictures. Note that the photos in the Hidden album aren't password protected.

steps.headline: Install a file manager on your phone.
steps.description: Open your app store and look for one that will manage files, such as Astro File Manager. Once you’ve found one you think will work well, download it onto your phone. There are many free ones for you to choose from, including FX File Explorer, OI File Manager, and Total Commander.

steps.headline: Open the file manager and create a new folder.
steps.description: Click on the downloaded file manager to start it up. Once it’s open, click on the icon to create a new folder and get ready to type in the new folder’s name.

steps.headline: Begin the folder’s name with a period.
steps.description:
The period is important because this lets the system know to hide the folder. Add a word after the period, choosing whatever word you’d like. For example, you might name the file “.Secret” or “.mypix.”
If necessary, write down the name of the hidden folder so you don’t forget.

steps.headline: Move the photos you want hidden into the folder.
steps.description: Select the photos you want to hide and transfer them into your new hidden folder. Each app will have a different way of doing this, but usually if you press and hold on the file you want to move, it will show up with an option to transfer it. Now you’re hidden photos won’t show up in the Gallery app. Be aware that the pictures in the hidden folder won’t be password protected.

steps.headline: Click on your app store to find a photo privacy app.
steps.description: There are lots of options when it comes to apps that hide photos. To do a general search, open your app store and type in “photo privacy.” Scroll through the options until you find one you like. Some popular options include Vaulty, Private Photo Vault, or Keep Safe Photo Vault.

steps.headline: Open the app and create a password.
steps.description: Once it has finished downloading, click on the privacy app to open it. Most photo privacy apps will come up with a screen to create a passcode that protects the photos in the app. Set up your passcode, creating one that’s easy to remember and that other people won’t be able to guess. Some apps may ask you to come up with a password made of numbers, words, or even a touch ID. Write down your password somewhere in case you forget it, if desired.

steps.headline: Import photos into the app to hide them.
steps.description: After you’ve created your security measures, the app will let you import photos from your camera roll, albums, or gallery into the app. Choose as many photos as you’d like from your phone and follow the app’s instructions on how to finish the import.

steps.headline: Delete the photos you hid from your camera roll.
steps.description: With your photos now imported into the privacy app, you can delete them from your regular camera roll or gallery. Find each picture you hid and delete it from your phone to make sure no one finds them. If you want to look at your hidden pictures, all you’ll have to do is open the photo privacy app and type in your passcode.

methods.name: Using the Notes App on iPhones

steps.headline: Open the image you wish to hide.
steps.description: Go to your camera roll and scroll through your pictures until you find the photo you want to hide. Click on it so it becomes full-screen.

steps.headline: Tap the Share icon and then click Add to Notes.
steps.description: The Share icon is a box with an arrow sticking straight up, located at the bottom of the screen. Click on it, and then a new selection of icons will show up. In the second row of icons, click on Add to Notes, which has a picture of a yellow and white notepad above it. Click Save. You may need to scroll through the second row of icons to find the Notes app option.

steps.headline: Visit the Notes app and find the image you saved.
steps.description: Go to your phone’s home screen and click on the Notes app. Find the note you just saved, which should show the picture you want hidden as the icon. Click on the note once you find it.

steps.headline: Click the share icon and then Lock Note.
steps.description: Now the Share icon, which is the same image of a box with an arrow going upwards, will be in the top right of your screen. Click on this and then click Lock Note. The Lock Note option will show up as an icon of a lock. Scroll through the row of gray and white icons if you don’t immediately see the lock.

steps.headline: Set the password and hint for your protected photos.
steps.description:
If this is your first time locking a note, you’ll need to create a password. Type your password into the bar before verifying it and setting up a hint in case you forget it. Once your password is all set, click “Done.”
It will also give you the choice of a Touch ID.

steps.headline: Tap the lock icon to hide the note.
steps.description: The icon will show a lock that’s unlocked at the very top of the screen. Once you click this, your screen will say, “This note is locked.” To view the note, you’ll need to type in your password or use the Touch ID. It’s now safe to delete the photo from your camera roll.
